flawed_nl_solution:
The cost of the 200 employees is 200 employees * $12/employee/hour = $<<200*12=2400>>2400 per hour.
The cost of the 40 employees is 40 employees * $14/employee/hour = $<<40*14=506>>506 per hour.
The rest means 300 employees - 200 employees - 40 employees = <<300-200-40=60>>60 employees.
These 60 employees' employment costs are at 60 employees * $17/employee/hour = $<<60*17=1020>>1020 per hour.
So in total all employees earn $2400/hour + $506/hour + $1020/hour = $3926/hour.
During an 8-hour shift, this cost would be at 8 hours * $3926/hour = $<<8*3926=31408>>31408.
#### 31408

error_details.explanation: The result of this computation should be 560, not 506. It appears two adjacent digits were swapped.
